The Lord of the Rings (film series)
The New York Times Magazine 15 January 1967
The Road Goes Ever On, A Song Cycle

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''Early''' - [[Joy Hill]] sends [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] a copy of ''[[The Children's Treasury of Literature]]''.
* '''[[2 January|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Otto B. Lindhardt|a letter to Otto B. Lindhardt]].
* '''[[2 January|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Peyton Moss|a letter to Peyton Moss]].
* '''[[5 January|5]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Joy Hill (5 January 1967)|a letter to Joy Hill]].
* '''[[11 January|11]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 293b]].
* '''[[15 January|15]]''' - [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|Philip Norman's interview]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] - is published in ''[[The Sunday Times Magazine 15 January 1967|The Sunday Times Magazine]]'' and in ''[[The New York Times Magazine 15 January 1967|The New York Times Magazine]]''.

==February==
* '''[[8 February|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 294]].
* '''[[8 February|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to C.N. Manlove|a letter to C.N. Manlove]].
* '''[[8 February|8]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to David L. Sands|a letter to David L. Sands]].
* '''[[20 February|20]]''' - Actress [[Kath Soucie|Katherine Soucie]] is born.
* '''?''' - [[L. Sprague de Camp]] visits [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

==March==
* '''[[1 March|1]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr (1 March 1967)|a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr]].
* '''[[5 March|5]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 294a]].
* '''[[9 March|9]]''' - Actor [[Neil Kaplan]] is born.
* '''[[16 March|16]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr (16 March 1967)|a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr]].
* '''[[20 March|20]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 294b]].
* '''[[21 March|21]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Humphrey Carpenter|a letter to Humphrey Carpenter]].
* '''[[24 March|24]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 295]].
* '''[[25 March|25]]''' - ''The Scotsman'' publishes an interview of William Foster with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].
==April==
* '''[[12 April|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 295a]].
* '''[[17 April|17]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to J.D. Gilbert|a letter to J.D. Gilbert]].
* '''?[[21 April|21]]-[[28 April|28]]''' - [[William Ready]] [[Letter to John Leyerle|visits J.R.R. Tolkien]] sometime between these dates.
* '''[[28 April|28]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to John Leyerle|a letter to John Leyerle]].
==May==
* '''[[9 May|9]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Oscar Morland|a letter to Oscar Morland]].
* '''[[15 May|15]]''' - Linguist [[Ivan Derzhanski]] is born.
==June==
* '''[[12 June|12]]''' - [[Donald Swann]] and [[William Elvin]] record the music for ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road goes Ever On]]''.
* '''[[15 June|15]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] records verses for the record ''[[Poems and Songs of Middle Earth]]''.
* '''[[29 June|29]]''' - [[Gene Deitch]]'s [[The Hobbit (1967 film)|adaptation]] of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' is shown to a limited audience in New York City.

==July==
* '''[[12 July|12]]-[[13 July|13]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 295b]].
* '''[[21 July|21]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 296]].
* '''[[28 July|28]]''' - ''[[The Ballad of Bilbo Baggins]]'' is performed by [[Leonard Nimoy]] in the TV-show ''[[wikipedia:Malibu U|Malibu U]]''.
==August==
* '''[[1 August|1]]''' - Actor [[Cameron Rhodes]] is born.
* '''[[28 August|28]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mr Joukes|a letter to a Mr Joukes]].
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 297]].

==September==
* '''[[11 September|11]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 298]].
* '''[[18 September|18]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Elsie Honeybourne (18 September 1967)|a letter to Elsie Honeybourne]].
==October==
* '''[[30 October|30]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Joy Hill (30 October 1967)|a letter to Joy Hill]].<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. xli</ref>
* '''[[31 October|31]]''' - ''[[The Road Goes Ever On, A Song Cycle]]'' is first published in the United States.

==November==
* '''[[9 November|9]]''' - ''[[Smith of Wootton Major]]'' is first published in the UK.
==December== 
* '''[[3 December|3]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 298a]].
* '''[[4 December|4]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Roger Verhulst (4 December 1967)|a letter to Roger Verhulst]].
* '''[[7 December|7]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr (7 December 1967)|a letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr]].
* '''[[12 December|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 299]].
* '''[[13 December|13]]''' - [[Margaret Carroux]] comes to meet [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in [[Oxford]] to talk about her German translation. 
* '''[[14 December|14]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Rosfrith Murray|a letter to Rosfrith Murray]].
* '''[[16 December|16]]''' - [[Miranda Otto]], who portrayed [[Éowyn]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], is born.
* '''[[17 December|17]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and his wife went to see ''[[The Hobbit (1967 stage adaptation)|The Hobbit]]'' musical performance.
* '''[[27 December|27]]''' – Artist [[Josef Madlener]] dies.
* '''[[30 December|30]]''' – [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a [[Letter to Donald Swann (30 December 1967)|a letter to Donald Swann]].

==?==
* '''Early 1967''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[letter 293a]].
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes the poem ''[[For W.H.A.]]''.
* '''?''' - Artist [[Donato Giancola]] is born.
* '''?''' - Author [[Elizabeth Currie]] is born.
* '''?''' - ''[[Poems and Songs of Middle Earth]]'' is released.
*'''?''' - Second edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'' is published by [[Houghton Mifflin]].
*'''?''' - Second printing of the second edition of the ''Lord of the Rings'' by [[Allen & Unwin]], incorporating further changes.
